projects:
[{'title': 'Iniciativa Comunales - Reclaiming the commons in the Llanisco mountains', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': "´My interest in natural resource governance led me to contact the  'Iniciativa Comunales' platform, which was initiated to promote the concept of the commons in Spain.  They offered me a chance to do an internship for a project on the commons in the municipality of Llanes. The project aims to present the necessary documentation so that the court can return the historical land rights of the public lands to the communities of the municipality.

My role in this project involves studying the commons and their historical land rights, recovering historical documentation, reviewing the cartography and interviewing the community members to classify the common areas of the llanisco mountains.

The main objective of this work is that the communities in the municipality of Llanes can recover the management and direct exploitation of the common natural resources by clearly establishing the ownership and the managing bodies. In this way, residents will be able to generate greater wealth and biodiversity, more employment, and, in addition, will facilitate the protection of the mountains against forest fires.

I was able to do this internship due to an Erasmus scholarship that was offered by my Master Degree Programme, for which I’m very grateful. Besides my studies having a complementary internship, offered me the chance to better understand the real-life implications of governance in environmental politics.´", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Robert', 'last_name': 'Croezen', 'name': None, 'headline': "International Master's Degree Programme in Environmental Policy & Law at the University of Eastern Finland."}]}]
